Vocabularies.Definition: n. 假定，假设
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Our assumption that we would win was wrong.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 破坏，毁灭
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The enemy bombs caused death and destruction.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.  get rid of; discard 摆脱；扔弃
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   A million tonnes of untreated sewage is dumped into the sea.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.  make able 使能够
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   This pass enables me to travel half-price on trains.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  a sudden, great increase; the act or an instance of exploding 激增；爆炸
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The study also forecast an explosion in the diet soft-drink market.

Vocabularies.Definition: in spite of  尽管
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   For all its beauty, the city could soon lose some of the individuality that had been preserved over the years.

Vocabularies.Definition: get away (from) go away 离开
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   There's a meeting after work, so I won't be able to get away from the office before.

Vocabularies.Definition: v.  make or become hard or harder （使）变硬
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Heat will harden this material and make it brittle too.

Vocabularies.Definition: v.  make (a palce) untidy by throwing away rubbish carelessly （在…）乱扔废物
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   He was fined for littering the park.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. the human race 人类
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g. We should make our contributions to mankind.

Vocabularies.Definition: only 仅仅；只有
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Nothing but a miracle can save him.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. a small piece, part, or section 小片，小块
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   There was a small patch of blue in the grey clouds.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. 掐（掉），夹；捏，拧
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   He pinched the child's cheek playfully.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.  make impure or unclean  污染；弄脏
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The rivers were polluted with chemical waste from factories.

Vocabularies.Definition: vi.  become corroded 被腐蚀；生锈
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The bicycle rusted when it was left out in the rain.

Vocabularies.Definition: (spoilt or spoiled) vt.  cause to become of no use or value; ruin 糟蹋；破坏
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   He spoiled the soup by putting too much salt in it.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.   discolor, soil, or spot  染污；玷污
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The coffee I spilt has stained my trousers.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  物质
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Soil consists of various chemical substances.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. a victory or conquest 胜利；征服
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Winning the battle is his greatest triumph.

Vocabularies.Definition: bring in or be brought to the shore （将…）冲上岸
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Cargo from the wrecked ship was washed up on the shore.
